item.title: Footpath & Cycle Way Obstructed for Weeks, 28th November
item.description:
Massive open hole blocking entire footpath and half of cycle route, for weeks now with absolutely NO work being done. The "flagship" walkway and cycle route left for weeks on end, with pedestrians having to use extreme caution as they are forced to use the cycle path as a result of there being no pavement, with electric bikes flying along at absurd speeds. Nothing has changed for weeks and it feels that the local highways agency treat the general public with utter contempt. How are contractors allowed to leave gaping holes in a footpath for weeks on end? Why isn't something being done about this complete disgrace?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Health and Safety, 27th November
item.description:
25 November 2025 went to Hesters Way Police Station Princess Elizabeth Way, Cheltenham GL51 7SU At about 16:00 I meet this Police Officer a woman told name PC COFFE I'm not sure. She didn't give me an crime reference. Luck thing inspect before walk in. Wonder going to let me down, put off frustration. Outdoors no justice an my Wonder cannot make up her mind from 2019 fall in love. Sheared my emotion expressed my feelings. An now it is to discussed. Not even had her part but went in vehicle with boys. How does that feel. Holding on to your things. Showing sign if to think figure out. If she is an Princess dress code features, find the Queen bird üê¶. I find makeup illegal the police lady got to mistreated. Why? I should spot out body movements an she Holding Secret. What should you do? Tell what is bothering her? Please if can help clear Up her airway around the premises heard mine the gaps look between the roads, now help an clear the gateway fences as the roads hazard danger unexpected collision. We all will make mistakes as an sinner, now is time not an child shall face the consequence. Please cover them, from disappointment. That is not the law should love an care. Henry might Vision see her as an motorway cop. Long away watching videos. She putting all the officer in serious risk. Makeup no confession in her family if so would of give information in the police station directing them to the Emergency Service Church

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Princess Elizabeth Way, Golden Valley, Cheltenham

item.title: Damage caused by articulated lorry, 27th November
item.description:
At the bottom of the hill where Syreford Road meets Bees Lane, next to Honeystones GL54 4HW. An articulated lorry initially tried to leave the village via Bees Lane. Realising he couldn't cross the ford, tried to reverse back up the steep hill adjact to Honeystones. He wrecked the verges and knocked down the 30 speed limit sign attempting to do so. Then he tried to turn right and damaged private property attempting to negotiate the tight bend. We need an "UNSUITABLE FOR HGV" sign on the crossroads next to the Reading Room because this is a recurrent problem where HGVs attempt to use the village roads as a shortcut between the A436 and the A40. Pleas would you reinstate the 30 limit sign and add an "UNSUITABLE FOR HGV" sign at this point. Residents are fed up with damage caused to their property by oversized vehicles attempting to pass through the village this way.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shipton, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Abandoned barriers in ditch, 27th November
item.description:
At least 2 half-height barriers in the ditch on left hand side of Kidnapper's lane just after you enter from Farm Lane. Don't appear to belong to the housing contractors as they have their own full-height fencing and the abandoned barriers are on the public/school side of the fencing
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kidnappers Lane, Warden Hill, Cheltenham

item.category: Signs & Barriers left behind by Contractor

item.title: Glebe Road Prestbury roadworks and flooding repairs., 27th November
item.description:
Glebe Road Prestbury roadworks and flooding repairs have done immense damage to the road, the kerbs and the verges. The workmen have been intermittent in attendance and leave the road in a terrible state, I cannot walk around the green without slipping on the piles of mud and the mess that has been created. It is not accepatable and none of the residents is clear about what has been achieved or whether the green, the verges and the kerbs will be put in a good state once finished. Nobody clears up at the end of each day and in fact no staff have turned up today the 27th November 2025. Its not looking good.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Glebe Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
